abstract:
RCTs [randomized control trials] on four specialized psychotherapies (DBT [dialectical behavior therapy], MBT [mentalization-based treatment], TFP [transference-focused therapy] and ST [ schema therapy])
adults (18 years and older) with BPD [Borderline personality disorder]
an individual psychotherapy component
had a duration of 16 weeks or more
comparison groups were other protocolized and specialized psychotherapies, or control groups, for example, treatment as usual (TAU), waiting list, attention control or community treatment by experts (CTBE).

an arbitrary cut-off of <66% of the participants having BPD [Borderline personality disorder], unless disaggregated data were provided.
tested incomplete versions of specialized treatment, for example, studies that investigated only skills training instead of the full DBT program.
